page.title: 02Ecology (Natural History)
page.content:
Natural History
The area lies in and around part of Eskdale, a large valley cut into the Jurrassic limestone and sandstone of the northern end of England's Jurrassic Belt. The valley floor is flat and very low lying. It has been extensively glaciated and large deposits of boulder clay have been left on the valley floor and lower slopes by the glaciers. Part of a small terminal moraine enters the north-western corner of the area. The higher ground of the area has not been glaciated and the soils are acid and thin. E.g. Skelder Top.
